document.title: Oklahoma Academic Standards for English Language Arts

9C0B3DC363D34EF5ABD57E3D595AE0B2.description: Students will express their ideas through a combination of drawing and emergent writing with guidance and support.

8F12A056DAD949EBB95D8D3B89F7B4C5.description: Writing: Students will write independently for extended periods of time. Students will vary their modes of expression to suit audience and task.

E50ECB36301E48D4B897FA7D8CAAA05D.description: Students will demonstrate interest in books during read-alouds and shared reading, and interact independently with books.

CAD9AA58F44F4354BEFDAD5D1D616179.description: Reading: Students will read independently for a variety of purposes and for extended periods of time. Students will select appropriate texts for specific purposes.

B596BABA9AA84D0BB0B94B2A31926CA4.description: Independent Reading and Writing - Students will read and write for a variety of purposes including, but not limited to, academic and personal.

2CD3C1F679EA4CBBB0764AA80ED1025E.description: Students will use appropriate technology to communicate with others with guidance and support.

0C65693E64084976A26E4E3CD1A34E41.description: Writing: Students will create multimodal texts to communicate knowledge and develop arguments.

9D2828C9CA0E491A9153CB8C2DA02CA7.description: Students will recognize formats of print and digital text with guidance and support.

819005DC4D2440E98F76907122381AE3.description: Reading: Students will evaluate written, oral, visual, and digital texts in order to draw conclusions and analyze arguments.

D77D2F03E637495093A77727FCEF6078.description: Multimodal Literacies - Students will acquire, refine, and share knowledge through a variety of written, oral, visual, digital, non-verbal, and interactive texts.

4CF6EAA468A049F7B2CA4EF7CDE5C3FE.description: Students will generate topics of interest and decide if a friend, teacher, or expert can answer their questions with guidance and support.

6A1567DFD46A43DAA866D789CE937C76.description: Writing: Students will summarize and paraphrase, integrate evidence, and cite sources to create reports, projects, papers, texts, and presentations for multiple purposes.

713625DEA8444711A474285B3AA5677B.description: Students will begin to identify pictures, charts, grade-appropriate texts, or people as sources of information on a topic of interest.

193D792306DC43E4946633A6DF29AC0F.description: Reading: Students will comprehend, evaluate, and synthesize resources to acquire and refine knowledge.

12AA6364CFA64CD6B0D5947C9E84CD49.description: Research - Students will engage in inquiry to acquire, refine, and share knowledge.

B3ABBFE793E847818945ABFA5889789B.description: Students will group pictures and movement, and determine spatial and time relationships such as up, down, before, and after with guidance and support.

EC5102F411C84CE8896DACE1614F8CD7.description: Students will recognize words as actions (i.e., verbs) with guidance and support.

C80F130868484201A675791BB99EA276.description: Students will recognize concrete objects as persons, places or things (i.e., nouns) with guidance and support.

6ADAD4D494B64AD1B52819E0CECBBF06.description: Students will begin to understand the function of grammar through exposure to conversations, read-alouds, and interactive reading.

98344ED646884968AF231754ED4EBD01.description: Reading: Students will apply knowledge of grammar and rhetorical style to analyze and evaluate a variety of texts.

08048414891E404282D5E76250CF9700.description: Language - Students will apply knowledge of grammar and rhetorical style to reading and writing.

5524676C22654872A1627BF89C0790C7.description: Students will begin to select appropriate language according to purpose.

F7C95B7620C14FBCB6204B92331A4BD6.description: Students will begin to use new vocabulary to produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

8475F9F21045427086697FD2955EFE60.description: Writing: Students will apply knowledge of vocabularies to communicate by using descriptive, academic, and domain-appropriate abstract and concrete words in their writing.

3483FDDEDC2742D9B11FE8D4377D1A37.description: Students will name and sort familiar objects into categories based on common attributes with guidance and support.

FD6D85C5595A4F8DAA09E6ACEB804091.description: Students will begin to develop an awareness of context clues through read-alouds and other text experiences.

CB9D326059FA458D87E6C87ECD0391E0.description: Students will acquire new academic, content-specific, grade-level vocabulary and relate new words to prior knowledge with guidance and support.

2A0BF236B2A64193BD65E9D6F9CB3CA7.description: Reading: Students will expand academic, domain-appropriate, grade-level vocabularies through reading, word study, and class discussion.

7F442D40A4EC455A9CCAC0CBBE9B4E75.description: Vocabulary - Students will expand their working vocabularies to effectively communicate and understand texts.

5E3D686F4AAE4049AD229518C09B2D1A.description: Students will use drawing, labeling, and dictating to express thoughts and ideas with guidance and support.

2CBB8CF59DFD4E65BABA843C60F029D8.description: Writing: Students will write for varied purposes and audiences in all modes, using fully developed ideas, strong organization, well-chosen words, fluent sentences, and appropriate voice.

89511AFA699448DBAD824DCBB576A009.description: Students will ask and answer basic questions (e.g., who, what, where, and when) about texts during shared reading or other text experiences with guidance and support.

9285D3D818934890A24326D81793EEAF.description: Students will tell what is happening in a picture or illustration with guidance and support.

27D745C08C964917A5CC6D40B26E7086.description: Students will describe characters in a story with guidance and support.

F843EDAA400649438A7E2E06118AA4AC.description: Students will describe the role of an author and illustrator, telling how they contribute to a story, with guidance and support.

CD234763925448AF86D61718E0B06568.description: Reading: Students will comprehend, interpret, evaluate, and respond to a variety of complex texts of all literary and informational genres from a variety of historical, cultural, ethnic, and global perspectives.

214907EC7DD84D1E8E828AE1DB7C3645.description: Critical Reading and Writing - Students will apply critical thinking skills to reading and writing.

5F278E69AE1A4878991BFF42919627F0.description: Students will begin to express themselves through drawing, dictating, and emergent writing.

0686433C32E24DCE91D16646781E62B7.description: Writing: Students will develop and strengthen writing by engaging in a recursive process that includes prewriting, drafting, revising, editing, and publishing.

AF075D3921354CF78DA7496A4A58EBE2.description: Students will begin to retell or reenact major events from a read-aloud with guidance and support to recognize the main idea.

FBFBE5D7FA92490CBCFF344202E055FA.description: Reading: Students will read and comprehend increasingly complex literary and informational texts.

C41FDC8466514E338638AEEB0D0E17AE.description: Reading and Writing Process - Students will use a variety of recursive reading and writing processes.

877EEE37087E47C89B684609D53DBA1C.description: Students will read first name in print.

01D9B64D190D4EE5862B04A26459DA85.description: Fluency: Students will recognize high-frequency words and read grade-level text smoothly and accurately, with expression that connotes comprehension.

7E819F0AC71741A1B97E8B38038773C0.description: Students will produce some sounds represented by letters with guidance and support.

02E1862AB5F34C08B8F5D28F11D998DE.description: Students will name the majority of the letters in their first name and many uppercase and lowercase letters with guidance and support.

C19763798246431A921C16BA748AFCA6.description: Phonics and Word Study: Students will decode and read words in context and isolation by applying phonics and word analysis skills.

F0A434D2AEA3432A9DE32F089E7A7531.description: Students will recognize ending punctuation marks in print during shared reading or other text experiences with guidance and support.

CA6D5EED39D94C099EE2149F894A4AFD.description: Students will begin to understand that print moves from top to bottom, left to right, and front to back.

BB5AB41DA2904A778FEB73354EDCF02E.description: Students will recognize that written words are made up of letters and are separated by spaces with guidance and support.

2A326DFCBBD84EEEBB1439364DD82714.description: Students will begin to demonstrate correct book orientation and identify the front and back covers of a book.

4231EC2626B74851AF6A475FCA2FDA70.description: Students will understand that print carries a message by recognizing labels, signs, and other print in the environment with guidance and support.

49DD34089E1A47059746D63ABBCEBDAE.description: Students will write the majority of the letters in their first name and some uppercase and lowercase letters with guidance and support.

E9DBE4DCAD364655889249319FE644F7.description: Print Concepts: Students will demonstrate their understanding of the organization and basic features of print, including book handling skills and the understanding that printed materials provide information and tell stories.

C6B665C7D3424A12B67F24BBC461FA52.description: Students will combine onsets and rimes to form familiar one syllable spoken words with pictorial support (e.g., /c/ + at = cat)

E067A1B8992944A787159CF5A21CF0E2.description: Students will begin to recognize initial sounds in a set of spoken words (i.e., alliteration).

EA253E8CD77A40F5B9E09118A27B3F8A.description: Students will begin to isolate initial and final sounds in spoken words.

EE20E35B286C452891D5A559495842C7.description: Students will begin to recognize syllables in spoken words (e.g., sunshine = sun + shine).

8326C73DD1B84E48B38627E9E0533AC0.description: Students will recognize spoken words that rhyme.

B4350F2382844F7A8B553FF55C795BBB.description: Students will distinguish spoken words in a sentence with guidance and support.

CC4827A2CBEB4107B2C6E74E056D66CE.description: Phonological Awareness: Phonological awareness is the ability to recognize, think about, and manipulate sounds in spoken language without using text.

ABFEF7EA816B4C32B7D6E553CC75A8C7.description: Reading Foundations - Students will develop foundational skills for future reading success by working with sounds, letters, and text.

2EEC6586E05F407F95CBE24275E7411C.description: Students will work respectfully with others with guidance and support.

6E0040EF74BC49569B1D18480720DFB9.description: Students will begin to orally describe personal interests or tell stories to classmates with guidance and support.

7491355647D745A59534A9EE28086960.description: Writing: Students will develop and apply effective communication skills through speaking and active listening to create individual and group projects and presentations.

86567E656BB24178B37EA038187DB7A5.description: Students will follow simple oral directions.

CC2FD99D077441D3BF5E7762FE7B474E.description: Students will begin to engage in collaborative discussions about appropriate topics and texts with peers and adults in small and large groups with guidance and support.

36E65DF9326447DFA24E8D9BF6F25098.description: Students will begin to ask and answer questions about information presented orally or through text or other media with guidance and support.

DC7FBB65A8044DE69FD16F46C512E67E.description: Students will actively listen and speak using agreed-upon rules with guidance and support.

160DB29F4056405BA0A45812BA731593.description: Reading: Students will develop and apply effective communication skills through speaking and active listening.

6E7C4F4AF0074A2BB337479A45F786EB.description: Speaking and Listening - Students will speak and listen effectively in a variety of situations including, but not limited to, responses to reading and writing.
